Data Types

JSON

type description
ActionAcknowledgementDTO This type is sent from a client that is processing actions to indicate an acknowledgement.
ActionDTO Holds information about an action.
ActionDataDTO Holds information sent to a message destination when an action fires.
ActionInfoDTO Contextual information about an action relative to its owning object. Returned as part of an object on which an action can be performed e.g. Incident, Task, etc.
ActionInvocationDTO Contains information about an action invocation
ActionInvocationMessageDTO Contains the information about a message received for an action invocation.
ActionInvokeDTO Contains the data necessary to invoke an action on an object
ActionSimpleFieldDefDTO Holds field information for the ActionDataDTO. Significantly simplified version of FieldDefDTO.
ActionSimpleTypeDTO Holds information about a type used in an ActionDataDTO object. This is a significantly simplified version of TypeDTO. It contains only the type information likely to be needed when processing actions. A note about implementation...Constructing the fields from the type and filter can be expensive due to database calls to get field value information. However most of the time that information is not used. Therefore the creation if the field/filter list is deferred until needed (when getFields() is called). The constructor just keeps track of the input information and then uses it during the getFields().
ActionsFrameworkInfoDTO Holds information about the actions framework.
AttachmentDTO Represents an attachment (either a task or incident attachment).
AttachmentHistoryDTO
AttachmentResultsDTO The results of a query on attachments.
AttachmentType Type of an attachment.
AuthenticationDTO Parameter for authenticate method.
AutomaticTaskDTO An automatic task template that gets instantiated when incidents are created or updated.
AutomationDefinitionDTO NOTE: The initial implementation of this was as an abstract class with an AutomationDefinitionSetFieldDTO subclass like this:
AutomationDefinitionType Type of an automation.
BucketBy An enumeration of the possible buckets (groupings) for values when performing pivots.
BucketByDTO Contains all of the information necessary to understand a BucketBy object.
CategorySearchResultDTO

This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

ChangePasswordInfoDTO
ColumnDTO Represents a filter column configuration.
CommentDTO
CommentPermsDTO
CommentResultsDTO The results of a query on comments.
CommentType Type of a comment.
ConditionDTO
ConfigurationExportDTO Contains the configuration data from an exported system

Note that v24 exports may contain exposure_vendors, exposure_departments and data_source properties, but those were never actually populated. We also no longer support them in v26+ (instead those values should get included as field values in the incident exposure_vendor_id, exposure_dept_id and data_source_ids fields). We ignore them on import.
ConfigurationExportHistoryDTO Contains all of the information about a previous configuration export.
ConfigurationExportsHistoryDTO Contains all of the configuration export histories.
ConfigurationHistoryDTO Common data between configuration import and export histories.
ConfigurationImportDTO
ConfigurationImportHistoryDTO Contains all of the information about a previous configuration import.
ConfigurationImportMessageDTO Contains a message relating to a configuration import.
ConfigurationImportsHistoryDTO Contains all of the configuration import histories.
ConfigurationOptionsDTO Contains all of the selected configuration choices for export.
ConstDTO

This type contains constant information for the server. This information is useful in translating names that the user sees to IDs that other REST API endpoints accept. For example, the IncidentDTO has a property called "crimestatus_id". The valid values are stored in ConstDTO's "crime_statuses" property.

This information generally only changes for new releases of Resilient.
CrimeStatusDTO
DataFormatTypeDTO
DataTableCellDataDTO Contains the data of a specific cell in a data table row
DataTableDataDTO Contains all of the data related to a user defined table on an incident
DataTableRowDataDTO Contains all of the data related to a table row on an incident
DataTypeDTO
DataTypeDiffDTO
DownloadDTO
EmailMessageDTO
EnabledDTO Contains information on enabled status
EvaluatableConditionsDTO DTO used to deserialize and store all the fields necessary to evaluate a set of conditions
FieldDefDTO Represents a field definition in the system.
FieldDefPermsDTO Defines the permissions available to the caller on a given field. This object is returned with each field object retrieved by the caller.
FieldDefValueDTO Represents a value in a select or multiselect field.
FieldDiffDTO
FieldPatchFailureDTO Represents a failure to patch a field.
FieldRequired Indicates when (if ever) a field is required. Use a value of null to indicate that a field is strictly optional.
FieldValModOperation The operation to perform on a field.
FilterContentDTO Represents a filter set content, stores filters conditions and columns configuration Use this DTO to represent content of layouts type LayoutType.INCIDENT_QUERY_FILTER.
ForWhoDTO
FullIncidentDataDTO Class to represent data sent for the creation of events (POST /rest/incidents).
FullOrgDTO
FullUserDTO Contains additional information about a user (beyond what's available in UserDTO).
FunctionDTO
FunctionType An enumeration representing the possible functions which may be applied to pivot cell contents to determine the cell value.
FunctionTypeDTO Contains all of the information necessary to understand a FunctionType object.
FutureDTO
GenericCountDTO
GeoDTO
GeoType The type of a geographic region.
GeoUnassignedDTO Indicates an "unassigned" count for a particular geo. These unassigned counts would generally be for "country". For example, if you know that you lost 500 records for the United States but you didn't know what specific state the records were for, you'd put them in as unassigned for the United States geo (ID #1000): { "geo": 1000, "count": 500 }
GroupDTO
HIPAARiskDTO Information that is required for incidents related to HIPAA.
HarmStatusDTO
HistoryItemDTO
IdentifierDTO Some REST methods return just an ID value. They use this class for their return.
IncSeverityDTO
IncidentArtifactDTO Contains information about an incident artifact.
IncidentArtifactLocationDTO Defines a geographic location
IncidentArtifactPermsDTO Stores the current user's permissions on an artifact.
IncidentArtifactPropertyDTO
IncidentArtifactResultDTO

This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

IncidentArtifactTypeDTO Definition of an artifact type.
IncidentBucketDTO
IncidentCommentDTO This object represents an incident comment. This class is being deprecated in v27.2 and will be removed in v29. Applications using this class should switch to using the CommentDTO class instead.
IncidentCountsDTO This type represents the counts of records that were lost as part of an incident.
IncidentDTO This object contains a minimal subset of the incident data. It is useful for displaying in a list.
IncidentDataTypesDTO This is a dynamic map that indicates which data types (e.g. Credit card number, SSN or SIN, etc.) that were lost as part of the incident. The key portion of the map is the data type ID and the value portion is a true/false boolean indicating whether the data type was lost. For example, the following JSON object indicates that the first name (id #19) and last name (id #20) were lost: { "19": true, "20": true } The list of possible data types (with their ID values) is available in the constDTO (data_types property).
IncidentHistoryDTO
IncidentPIIDTO
IncidentPermsDTO
IncidentResultDTO

This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the results of the search.

IncidentStatusDTO Represents an incident status.
IncidentSummaryDTO Configuration options for exported incident data.
IncidentTypeDTO Represents an incident type in the system (e.g. Malware, Phishing, etc.).
IndustryDTO
InputType A type of input field in the system.
InputTypeDTO Represents a supported input type in the system. Fields in the system have a type (e.g. select, multiselect, text, etc.). This structure tells you various bits of information about the type.
IntegerCountDTO
InvitationDetailsDTO Represents an invitation in the system. When you create an invitation, the user mentioned in the email field will be sent a message with a URL that allows them to join as a user.
JustOrgDTO Information about an organization.
JustUserDTO Contains information about a user.
LatLngDTO Defines a geographic location
LayoutDTO Represents a layout
LayoutPermsDTO Represents the permissions on a layout.
LayoutType Enumeration for layout types.
LayoutViewConditionDTO Represents a "show_if" condition inside a layoutViewItemDTO.
LayoutViewItemDTO Represents an item inside a view.
LdapGroupDTO This object contains information about a group from the directory.
LdapGroupMembersDTO
LdapGroupRequestDTO
LdapGroupsDTO This object contains information about groups from an LDAP directory.
ListContainerDTO A container for holding a list of entities.
MembersDTO An object that contains IDs of incident or task members.
MessageDestinationDTO Holds information about message destinations. Message destinations are associated with actions so that when an action is triggered, a message is sent to the destination.
MethodName IMPORTANT: Do NOT add new enum values anywhere other than at the end of this script!!! The numeric values that correspond to these items get stored in the database
MethodNamePermsDTO Holds "permissions" applicable to a method name/operation, such as whether it should appear in conditions for manual actions, automatic actions and notifications.
MilestoneDTO
MilestonePermsDTO
ModifyUserDTO
MoveDTO Represents a move request.
MultiPatchDTO Represents patches to multiple objects.
MultiPatchStatusDTO The results of a PATCH operation on a batch of PatchDTO objects.
MultipleActionInvokeDTO Contains the data necessary to invoke an action on multiple objects
NISTAttackVectorDTO
NamedEntityDTO
NewAndOpenIncidentsDTO
NewsfeedEntryDTO
NewsfeedEntryType The type of newsfeed entry.
NewsfeedObjectType The type of the object referenced in the newsfeed.
NotificationDTO Represents a notification in the system.

Prior to version 28 the template definition and substitution values are provided so the API client can perform substitution. Starting with version 28 the template functionality has been been expanded and substitution is performed on the server and provided back as part of this object in notification_text.

Starting with version 29 the following fields will be removed:

inc_id

inc_training

task_name

task_id

comment_text

comment_id

NotificationDefDTO
NotificationDefPermsDTO
ObjectHandle A handle to an object in the REST API. The handle can be an object ID (integer) or an object name (string). The server will recognize the type and lookup the object.

For example, the incidentDTO's resolution_id field can be specified as the name of the resolution selection (e.g. "Duplicate") or with it's ID value (which you have to lookup separately).

Note that data is returned from the server with the ID values by default. If you wish to receive name values back for objectHandle fields from the server instead, you can set handle_format=names either in a query string (e.g. https://resilient.mycompany.com/rest/orgs/:orgId/incidents?handle_format=names) or in an HTTP header. For a description of the possible values of the handle_format query string parameter/HTTP header, see objectHandleFormat.

When setting ObjectHandle values the server will work with either format. You only need to indicate what type of output you want. Versions of the Resilient Systems server prior to v23 only accepted ID values and would convert string values ("55") to integers where possible. As of v23, the server will not automatically convert strings to their number equivalent. So if your API program used to send "55" assuming that the server would convert it to 55, you will either have to change your program to send the integer or you can work around the problem by setting handle_format=ids, which will again allow the conversion to happen.
ObjectHandleFormat Represents the type of output you want for objectHandle objects. You can specify which behavior you want by setting the handle_format HTTP header or query string parameter. For example, if retrieving an incident and you want to get back "names", you could use this URL: 
https://server/rest/orgs/201/incidents/54321?handle_format=names

If both the HTTP header and query string are specified, the query string takes precedence. This allows you to specify a default in the HTTP header, but override it on a per-request basis.
ObjectHandleList Represents a list of ObjectHandle objects. Each item in the list can be either a name (string) or ID (integer).
ObjectPermsDTO
OpenIncidentsByPhaseDTO
OperationType Enumeration for operation types that can be applied to an object.
OrgDataTypesDTO
OrgGeoDTO
OrgIncidentArtifactTypeDTO Represents an organization's artifact relatability settings. NOTE: This is deprecated in version 28. Please use incidentArtifactTypeDTO instead.
OrgIndDTO
OrgNetworkDTO
OrgRegDTO
OrgSettingsDTO Contains the data related to the organization settings
OrgStatisticsDTO
OrgTimeframeDTO Contains the information about the timeframe. Theses are used when calculating the due dates for built-in tasks.
OrgTimeframesDTO Contains the information about the timeframes. These are used when calculating due dates on built-in tasks.
OrganizationPropertyDTO
PagedResultsDTO
PartialActionDTO Holds basic information about an action.
PartialFieldDefDTO
PartialFieldDefValueDTO
PartialIncidentDTO This object contains a minimal subset of the incident data. It is useful for displaying in a list.
PartialScriptDTO Contains basic information about an invokable script.
PatchChangeDTO Contains information about a patch change to an object
PatchDTO Contains all of the information needed to patch the values of an object, which allows for partial updates of objects.
PatchStatusDTO This object indicates whether an operation was successful or not.
PatchValueDTO The old or new value being patched
PermsDTO Represents the permissions that a user has (e.g. whether they can create incidents, are a master administrator, etc.).
PhaseDTO Represents a phase.
PhasePermsDTO Permissions of the phase.
PivotCellDTO Contains the information about a cell in a pivot table.
PivotConstDTO
PivotDTO The result of performing a pivot on object data.
PivotFieldDTO
PivotFieldType An enumeration representing the possible field types available for pivot services.
PivotFieldTypeDTO Contains all of the information necessary to understand a PivotFieldType object.
PivotHeaderDTO Represents a column or row header in a pivot table. e.g. Severity, Incident Type
PivotQueryDTO Contains all the necessary data to perform a pivot on an object type
PivotValueDTO A hierarchy of column/row field values for a pivot table.
PredefinedViewItemDTO Represents a predefined wizard item or incident tab.
PrincipalAssignmentInfoDTO
PropertyTypes
QueryDTO
QueryFilterDTO
QueryPagedDTO
QuerySortDTO
ReassignAssignmentsDTO This object contains the IDs of the users to reassign incidents or/and tasks
RecordCountDiffDTO
RegulatorDTO
RegulatorsDTO A container object that contains a simple array of regulator IDs.
RelatedIncidentDTO Contains information about an incident that is related to another incident. This object is returned in the context of another incident. For example, if Incident#1 is being retrieved, it might have Incident#2 as a related incident. In that case, there will be a relatedIncidentDTO object for Incident#2 - depending on the caller, it can return just the data related to Incident#1, or it could return the complete data for Incident#2. Refer to the specific API documentation for details.
RelatedIncidentsDTO
RevisionBaseDTO
ScriptDTO Contains the full information about an invokable script.
ScriptExecuteDTO Used for running scripts for debugging purposes. Contains context for the script to execute against and the script itself.
ScriptExecutionChangeDTO Contains the information about a patch change to an object from the scripting service
ScriptExecutionDTO The results of running a script under the context of an action. Contains messages that resulted from its execution
ScriptExecutionMessageDTO Contains the messages from executing a script
ScriptExecutionPatchDTO Contains the information about the changes to an object from the scripting service
ScriptMetadataDTO Contains the metadata for code-completion for the script editor
ScriptMetadataKeywordDTO Contains the information for the scripting code-completion keywords
ScriptMetadataSnippetDTO Contains the information for the scripting code-completion keywords
ScriptMetadataSuggestionDTO Contains the base information necessary for suggestions for script code-completion
SearchExInputDTO Parameters for performing a search
SearchExResultDTO A single result from an elastic search
SearchExResultsDTO A list of the results from an elastic search
SearchInputDTO Holds the details of a search query. Used in the POST /rest/search endpoint.

This DTO class is deprecated in v28 and will be removed in v29. GET /rest/search and POST /rest/search are deprecated and being replaced by POST /rest/search_ex which uses a different DTO class to convey the inputs to a search.

SearchResultDTO
ServerVersionDTO Holds information about the server's version (major, minor and build number).
SessionOrgInfoDTO Contains the information about a user's status in an org in a session. It contains the information about the org, whether or not the org is currently accessible in the session, and the permissions for the user in the org.
SessionOrgInfoPermsDTO Represents the permissions that a user has (e.g. whether they can create incidents, are a master administrator, etc.).
StateDTO This type holds information about a US state (e.g. California, Massashusetts).
StatisticalCountsDTO Type for holding information about statistical counts. For example, the number of incidents by their incident status.
StatisticsIncidentDTO This is the DTO used to represent an incident for statistical purposes. It is a minimalistic representation
StatisticsTaskDTO
StatusDTO This object indicates whether an operation was successful or not.
SupportedLanguageDTO
SystemTaskDTO
SystemTaskOverrideDTO Indicates that the object represented by this DTO is importable
TaskCatDTO Represents an incident's task tree.
TaskCategoryDTO Represent a task category object.
TaskChangeDTO
TaskCommentDTO Represents a task comment. This class is being deprecated in v27.2 and will be removed in v29. Applications using this class should switch to using the CommentDTO class instead.
TaskCountDTO
TaskDTO Represents a task object.
TaskOrderEntryDTO
TaskPermsDTO
TaskRegsDTO
TaskStatusDTO Represents a task status.
TextContentDTO Represents text content (e.g. incident description, incident resolution summary, artifact description, etc.). The Resilient server will accept either a JSON string or an object of the form: 
   {
     "format": "html|text",
     "content": "content text or HTML (depending on format)"
   }

If you send a string, you must be aware of the "rich_text" setting on the field you're sending. If sending an object, you can supply content in either "text" or "html" format. The server will make a best effort to convert the content into the format needed to display the field in the UI.

On output (e.g. the return from a GET, PUT or POST), the textContentDTO is written as a JSON string by default. The content of the string object will depend on the "rich_text" property of the field. So if "rich_text" is true, then the content will be HTML. If "rich_text" is false, then the content will be in plain text. Note that it is technically possible for the content to be stored on the server in plain text for fields that are marked as rich text (or vice-versa). When the server is in the default mode, it will convert the data to the format specified in the field definition and write it out as a JSON string. For example, if the content on the server is plain text but the field definition is "rich text", then the server will perform a plain text to HTML conversion. The reverse can occur too, for example if an API program sends HTML but the field definition is not rich text then the server will perform a best effort at an HTML to plain text conversion.

An API client can request that data be sent in whatever format it is in on the server by specifying the "text_content_output_format=objects_no_convert" query string or HTTP header. In this case, the server will send the full object.

An API client can also request that data be sent as an object, but have conversion applied by specifying the "text_content_output_format=objects_convert" query string or HTTP header. In this case, the server will send the full object and convert to the format specified in the field definition (if "rich_text" is true then the format will always be returned as "html" and if it's false then it'll always be returned as "text").

An API client can also ask for data in either HTML or text format specifically (regardless of the field definition and the format in which the data is stored) by using either the text_content_output_format=objects_html or text_content_output_format=objects_text request query string or HTTP header.
TextContentOutputFormat Enum that maps to the "text_content_output_format" HTTP header and query string parameter.

The serialization of textContentDTO objects an depend on three factors:

  • The text_content_output_format HTTP header or query string parameter.
  • The field definition's "rich text" setting (whether rich text is supported for the field).
  • The storage format of the data on the server.
Each of the text_content_output_format settings will do things differently. See comments of each one for details.

You can specify the text_content_output_format as an HTTP header or query string parameter. If both are specified, the query string parameter takes precedence.

Here's an example of specifying the text_content_output_format as a query string parameter: 

https://server/rest/orgs/201/incidents/54321?text_content_output_format=objects_convert
TextFormat Represents the format in which the content in a textContentDTO object is stored.
ThreatHitDTO Holds information about artifact hits against a threat source.

TimeUnitDTO Represents a time unit in the system. Current values are days, months, years, hours, minutes. These are used to calculate due dates for tasks.
TimeframeDTO Contains the information about a timeframe. These are used when calculating the due dates for built-in tasks.
TwoFactorAuthCookieInfoDTO
TwoFactorAuthDomainDTO This object contains information about a two factor authentication domain
TwoFactorVerificationDTO
TypeDTO Represents a type object in the system. This includes built-in types such as "incident" and "task", as well as custom types (Data Table)
TypeId
TypePropertiesDTO Contains additional information about the type for conditions and notifications.
TypedObjectReferenceDTO An instance of an object and the type of that object instance.

This differs from an ObjectHandle in that the type is provided along with the object name and type name. An object handle on the other hand may not have the names available depending on how the client has requested the ObjectHandleFormat.

In addition this reference provides the full parent instance hierarchy for the object. For example, a note will have either a parent incident or a task. A task instance will have a parent incident. Null indicates the instance has no parent.

UserDTO Contains information about a user.

WorkflowDTO Contains the information about a workflow

WorkflowStatusDTO Indicates the status of a workflow deployment.

typedObjectReferenceDTO An instance of an object and the type of that object instance.

This differs from an ObjectHandle in that the type is provided along with the object name and type name. An object handle on the other hand may not have the names available depending on how the client has requested the ObjectHandleFormat.

In addition this reference provides the full parent instance hierarchy for the object. For example, a note will have either a parent incident or a task. A task instance will have a parent incident. Null indicates the instance has no parent.

userDTO Contains information about a user.
userGroupsDTO
userNotificationInfoDTO Information about a user's notifications

userSessionDTO Class for transferring information about the currently logged in user.

actionAcknowledgementDTO This type is sent from a client that is processing actions to indicate an acknowledgement.
actionDTO Holds information about an action.
actionDataDTO Holds information sent to a message destination when an action fires.
actionInfoDTO Contextual information about an action relative to its owning object. Returned as part of an object on which an action can be performed e.g. Incident, Task, etc.
actionInvocationDTO Contains information about an action invocation
actionInvocationMessageDTO Contains the information about a message received for an action invocation.
actionInvokeDTO Contains the data necessary to invoke an action on an object
actionSimpleFieldDefDTO Holds field information for the ActionDataDTO. Significantly simplified version of FieldDefDTO.
actionSimpleTypeDTO Holds information about a type used in an ActionDataDTO object. This is a significantly simplified version of TypeDTO. It contains only the type information likely to be needed when processing actions. A note about implementation...Constructing the fields from the type and filter can be expensive due to database calls to get field value information. However most of the time that information is not used. Therefore the creation if the field/filter list is deferred until needed (when getFields() is called). The constructor just keeps track of the input information and then uses it during the getFields().
automationDefinitionDTO NOTE: The initial implementation of this was as an abstract class with an AutomationDefinitionSetFieldDTO subclass like this:
messageDestinationDTO Holds information about message destinations. Message destinations are associated with actions so that when an action is triggered, a message is sent to the destination.
multipleActionInvokeDTO Contains the data necessary to invoke an action on multiple objects
partialActionDTO Holds basic information about an action.

incidentCommentDTO This object represents an incident comment. This class is being deprecated in v27.2 and will be removed in v29. Applications using this class should switch to using the CommentDTO class instead.

taskCommentDTO Represents a task comment. This class is being deprecated in v27.2 and will be removed in v29. Applications using this class should switch to using the CommentDTO class instead.
conditionDTO
configurationExportDTO Contains the configuration data from an exported system

Note that v24 exports may contain exposure_vendors, exposure_departments and data_source properties, but those were never actually populated. We also no longer support them in v26+ (instead those values should get included as field values in the incident exposure_vendor_id, exposure_dept_id and data_source_ids fields). We ignore them on import.

geoUnassignedDTO Indicates an "unassigned" count for a particular geo. These unassigned counts would generally be for "country". For example, if you know that you lost 500 records for the United States but you didn't know what specific state the records were for, you'd put them in as unassigned for the United States geo (ID #1000): { "geo": 1000, "count": 500 }
incidentCountsDTO This type represents the counts of records that were lost as part of an incident.
incidentDataTypesDTO This is a dynamic map that indicates which data types (e.g. Credit card number, SSN or SIN, etc.) that were lost as part of the incident. The key portion of the map is the data type ID and the value portion is a true/false boolean indicating whether the data type was lost. For example, the following JSON object indicates that the first name (id #19) and last name (id #20) were lost: { "19": true, "20": true } The list of possible data types (with their ID values) is available in the constDTO (data_types property).
partialIncidentDTO This object contains a minimal subset of the incident data. It is useful for displaying in a list.

phasePermsDTO Permissions of the phase.

textContentDTO Represents text content (e.g. incident description, incident resolution summary, artifact description, etc.). The Resilient server will accept either a JSON string or an object of the form: 
   {
     "format": "html|text",
     "content": "content text or HTML (depending on format)"
   }

If you send a string, you must be aware of the "rich_text" setting on the field you're sending. If sending an object, you can supply content in either "text" or "html" format. The server will make a best effort to convert the content into the format needed to display the field in the UI.

On output (e.g. the return from a GET, PUT or POST), the textContentDTO is written as a JSON string by default. The content of the string object will depend on the "rich_text" property of the field. So if "rich_text" is true, then the content will be HTML. If "rich_text" is false, then the content will be in plain text. Note that it is technically possible for the content to be stored on the server in plain text for fields that are marked as rich text (or vice-versa). When the server is in the default mode, it will convert the data to the format specified in the field definition and write it out as a JSON string. For example, if the content on the server is plain text but the field definition is "rich text", then the server will perform a plain text to HTML conversion. The reverse can occur too, for example if an API program sends HTML but the field definition is not rich text then the server will perform a best effort at an HTML to plain text conversion.

An API client can request that data be sent in whatever format it is in on the server by specifying the "text_content_output_format=objects_no_convert" query string or HTTP header. In this case, the server will send the full object.

An API client can also request that data be sent as an object, but have conversion applied by specifying the "text_content_output_format=objects_convert" query string or HTTP header. In this case, the server will send the full object and convert to the format specified in the field definition (if "rich_text" is true then the format will always be returned as "html" and if it's false then it'll always be returned as "text").

An API client can also ask for data in either HTML or text format specifically (regardless of the field definition and the format in which the data is stored) by using either the text_content_output_format=objects_html or text_content_output_format=objects_text request query string or HTTP header.
textFormat Represents the format in which the content in a textContentDTO object is stored.
objectHandle A handle to an object in the REST API. The handle can be an object ID (integer) or an object name (string). The server will recognize the type and lookup the object.

For example, the incidentDTO's resolution_id field can be specified as the name of the resolution selection (e.g. "Duplicate") or with it's ID value (which you have to lookup separately).

Note that data is returned from the server with the ID values by default. If you wish to receive name values back for objectHandle fields from the server instead, you can set handle_format=names either in a query string (e.g. https://resilient.mycompany.com/rest/orgs/:orgId/incidents?handle_format=names) or in an HTTP header. For a description of the possible values of the handle_format query string parameter/HTTP header, see objectHandleFormat.

When setting ObjectHandle values the server will work with either format. You only need to indicate what type of output you want. Versions of the Resilient Systems server prior to v23 only accepted ID values and would convert string values ("55") to integers where possible. As of v23, the server will not automatically convert strings to their number equivalent. So if your API program used to send "55" assuming that the server would convert it to 55, you will either have to change your program to send the integer or you can work around the problem by setting handle_format=ids, which will again allow the conversion to happen.
objectHandleList Represents a list of ObjectHandle objects. Each item in the list can be either a name (string) or ID (integer).
authenticationDTO Parameter for authenticate method.
identifierDTO Some REST methods return just an ID value. They use this class for their return.
